title: How Women's Basic Rights And Freedoms Are Being Eroded All Over The World
content: From Iraq to Afghanistan to the US, basic freedoms for women are being eroded as governments start rolling back existing laws.
summary: From Iraq to Afghanistan to the US, basic freedoms for women are being eroded as governments start rolling back existing laws.

title: Indian Diplomats In Canada Under Surveillance, Centre Tells Parliament
content: Consular officials at the Indian consulate in Vancouver were recently informed by the Canadian authorities that they have been and continue to be under "audio and video surveillance", the Centre informed Parliament on Thursday.
summary: Consular officials at the Indian consulate in Vancouver were recently informed by the Canadian authorities that they have been and continue to be under "audio and video surveillance", the Centre informed Parliament on Thursday.

title: Russia Needs A Peace Deal Soon As It Is Running Out Of Soldiers
content: For Putin, Trump's win couldn't come soon enough. Putin may reportedly accept a deal where Moscow gains significant territory in Ukraine (about the size of Virginia) and Ukraine remains neutral and forgets about any plans to join NATO or the EU.
summary: For Putin, Trump's win couldn't come soon enough. Putin may reportedly accept a deal where Moscow gains significant territory in Ukraine (about the size of Virginia) and Ukraine remains neutral and forgets about any plans to join NATO or the EU.

title: After 10 Years Of Debate, COP29's Carbon Trading Deal Is Seriously Flawed
content: Negotiators at the COP29 climate conference in Baku have struck a landmark agreement on rules governing the global trade of carbon credits, bringing to a close almost a decade of debate over the controversial scheme.
summary: Negotiators at the COP29 climate conference in Baku have struck a landmark agreement on rules governing the global trade of carbon credits, bringing to a close almost a decade of debate over the controversial scheme.

title: Nigeria Reels Under 'Cryptic Pregnancy' Scam. All Your Questions Answered
content: The women who come in for these treatments are given mysterious injections that claim that couples can "select" the sex of their future baby which is medically impossible.
summary: The women who come in for these treatments are given mysterious injections that claim that couples can "select" the sex of their future baby which is medically impossible.

title: Israel Strikes Hezbollah Facility In Lebanon A Day After Ceasefire Began
content: The Israeli military on Thursday said it hit a facility in southern Lebanon belonging to Iran-backed militant group Hezbollah, a day after a ceasefire between the group and Israel began.
summary: The Israeli military on Thursday said it hit a facility in southern Lebanon belonging to Iran-backed militant group Hezbollah, a day after a ceasefire between the group and Israel began.

title: K-Pop Band NewJeans Leaves ADOR, Agency Says Contract Still Stands
content: The announcement by the pop group soon started circulating on social media and NewJeans became one of the top trends on X.
summary: The announcement by the pop group soon started circulating on social media and NewJeans became one of the top trends on X.

title: Australia Passes Landmark Order Banning Social Media For Under-16s
content: Australian lawmakers passed landmark rules to ban under 16s from social media on Thursday, approving one of the world's toughest crackdowns on popular sites like Facebook, Instagram and X.
summary: Australian lawmakers passed landmark rules to ban under 16s from social media on Thursday, approving one of the world's toughest crackdowns on popular sites like Facebook, Instagram and X.

title: Young Gorilla Dies At Canada Zoo After Being Crushed By Hydraulic Door
content: A young gorilla at a Canadian zoo died after a staff member accidentally crushed its head with a hydraulic door.
summary: A young gorilla at a Canadian zoo died after a staff member accidentally crushed its head with a hydraulic door.

title: Indian-Origin Neurosurgeon Fined Over $2 Million For Medicare Fraud In US
content: A 53-year-old Indian-origin neurosurgeon in the US was fined over USD 2 million for medicare fraud after falsely claiming to perform surgeries to implant electro-acupuncture devices.
summary: A 53-year-old Indian-origin neurosurgeon in the US was fined over USD 2 million for medicare fraud after falsely claiming to perform surgeries to implant electro-acupuncture devices.

title: Massive 411-Mile Snowstorm To Hit UK This Week, Warnings Issued
content: Temperature is likely to fall below zero in Scotland, while in England and Wales, it will hover around 4-5 degree Celsius.
summary: Temperature is likely to fall below zero in Scotland, while in England and Wales, it will hover around 4-5 degree Celsius.

title: Russia Weaponises Ukraine Winter, Hits Power Plants, Millions In The Dark
content: As stated by Ukraine's president Vlodymyr Zelenskyy, cluster munitions were particularly used against civilians and energy infrastructure. He has called the attack out as a "very mean escalation" in the conflict.
summary: As stated by Ukraine's president Vlodymyr Zelenskyy, cluster munitions were particularly used against civilians and energy infrastructure. He has called the attack out as a "very mean escalation" in the conflict.

title: Watch: Indo-Canadian Couple Share "Lies" They Were Told Before Marriage
content: A video showing an Indian-Canadian couple talking about "misconceptions" they had about each other's culture is going on social media.
summary: A video showing an Indian-Canadian couple talking about "misconceptions" they had about each other's culture is going on social media.

title: Bangladesh High Court Refuses To Ban ISKCON In Country: Report
content: The High Court on Thursday refused to ban ISKCON's activities in Bangladesh, a local newspaper reported days after a lawyer was killed in a clash between security personnel and supporters of a Hindu leader arrested on sedition charges.
summary: The High Court on Thursday refused to ban ISKCON's activities in Bangladesh, a local newspaper reported days after a lawyer was killed in a clash between security personnel and supporters of a Hindu leader arrested on sedition charges.

title: Woman Sneaks Onto Plane And Flies From US To Paris Without Boarding Pass
content: A female stowaway on Tuesday bypassed multiple security checkpoints at New York's John F Kennedy International Airport and onto a Paris-bound Delta Airlines flight without a boarding pass or identification.
summary: A female stowaway on Tuesday bypassed multiple security checkpoints at New York's John F Kennedy International Airport and onto a Paris-bound Delta Airlines flight without a boarding pass or identification.

title: 'Hindu Monk's Arrest Unjust, Must Be Freed': Bangladesh Ex-PM Sheikh Hasina
content: Bangladesh's ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina today spoke out about the arrest of a Hindu priest in her country. She also spoke about the death of a lawyer who was killed during clashes arising out a protest after the monk's arrest.
summary: Bangladesh's ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina today spoke out about the arrest of a Hindu priest in her country. She also spoke about the death of a lawyer who was killed during clashes arising out a protest after the monk's arrest.

title: US Embassy In Pakistan Issues Security Alert For Peshawar
content: The US Mission here has issued a security alert urging its citizens not to visit Peshawar in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province in northwest Pakistan until December 16 due to "security concerns."
summary: The US Mission here has issued a security alert urging its citizens not to visit Peshawar in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province in northwest Pakistan until December 16 due to "security concerns."

title: Mysterious 'Pillars Of Light' Falling From Sky Spotted In Canada, See Pics
content: This occurs during extremely cold temperatures, often producing a stunning visual effect resembling columns of light stretching into the sky.
summary: This occurs during extremely cold temperatures, often producing a stunning visual effect resembling columns of light stretching into the sky.

title: What Centre Told Parliament About Attacks On Hindus, Temples In Bangladesh
content: As incidents of violence and vandalism against the minority Hindu community see a sharp upturn in Bangladesh, questions were asked in the Parliament of India out of concern for human rights violations.
summary: As incidents of violence and vandalism against the minority Hindu community see a sharp upturn in Bangladesh, questions were asked in the Parliament of India out of concern for human rights violations.

title: Report Says Nissan Has Just 12-14 Months To Survive, Elon Musk Reacts
content: Nissan's financial crisis is compounded by Renault's decision to reduce its stake in the company.
summary: Nissan's financial crisis is compounded by Renault's decision to reduce its stake in the company.
